channel.title: Replaying HL2 - Help me make it better!
channel.description:
As the title suggests, i finally reinstalled Steam and Half-Life2. i haven't played it in over 2 years which is strange considering i used to play BOTH Half-Life games annually...
Anyway, i lurked around Google and i prodded some (old) forums, but i can't seem to get any straight, clear answers or suggestions. My computer has gone through some serious upgrades, so i'm willing to push the envelope a little further both graphically and in variety. What mods do i want to use to make Half-Life2 a better experience this time around?
Most of the mini-mods i tried were old and refused to work right thanks to Steam updates. One promised bloom and HDR effects but only delivered a purple checker pattern across my screen (thanks alot, Steam!). i'm looking for serious additions to the HL2 game. SMOD sounded like fun but i want something serious. i like the idea of physics and melee attacks but throwing explosive bananas?
if anybody has any suggestions, i'm all for them...provided i don't have to download 5gig of new HDR maps.
-Kawai Tei-

item.dc:creator: Alcator
item.description:
Tei:

My computer has gone through some serious upgrades, so i’m willing to push the envelope a little further both graphically and in variety. What mods do i want to use to make Half-Life2 a better experience this time around?

Sorry for sounding conservative, but if you MOD it, it’s no longer Half-Life 2. It’s something different. I’d compare it to making a fan-cut of a movie – it’s no longer the original movie.

Just tune the graphics settings up as high as possible, and enjoy. Or you can go for some extra challenge by self-placed restrictions, such as “No alt fire” or “No automatic weapons” or “No health stations”.

I even heard about an asshole who missed the hovercraft and made it through majority of Water Hazard ON FOOT…

item.title: Replaying HL2 - Help me make it better!
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
Tei:

Just tried the the Cinematic Mod (ver2).
i feel like i wasted six and a half hours downloading two whopping gigs of rusty looking textures. i liked the screenshots that appeared to offer NEW models and textures. …but it doesn’t really ADD anything to the game. All it does is change NPCs into…ugly people. Most of the main characters got re-skinned too. The “added” soundtrack was disappointing too. it’s good music but it doesn’t fit the game’s mood properly.

What did I tell you? Save yourself some time and don’t bother with the dozens of shitty Smod variants.
